    Team News

    Atletico Madrid
    • Moya is fit for the hosts here, though Jan Oblak will keep his place in between the sticks.
    • Diego Simeone has confirmed that Mario Mandzukic will start here and he could partner Antoine Griezmann up front, with Fernando Torres dropping to the bench.
    • Raul Garcia is a doubt with a wrist problem, but could be OK to make the bench.
    Real Madrid
    • Real Madrid have no injury or suspension concerns ahead of Tuesday's Madrid Derby.
    • Gareth Bale missed Saturday's welcome of Eibar through injury, but has been included in the matchday squad and looks set to start.
    • Carlo Ancelotti will be expected to field his first choice XI for the trip to the Calderon.

    Prediction

    • Atletico's league form has stuttered of late and they now sit 7 points behind their city rivals coming into this one. However, Diego Simeone's side have won their last 3 competitive meetings with Madrid at the Calderon and they will, once more, be confident of securing victory in this one.
    • Madrid appear to have found their form once more and have won their last 3 league games, netting 14 goals in the process. Their recent Champions League form, however, is questionable. They may have overcome Schalke at the last-16 stage, but conceded 4 at home to the Bundesliga side last time out.
    • This is a close one to call, but Atletico's dominance at home means they could sneak this one.
    Prediction:
    Atletico Madrid
    2
    1
    Real Madrid
